hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
source /home/test/.bashrc #Install dependencies sudo yum install -y curl wget tar gcc gcc-c++ make flex zip unzip git vim libstdc++-* binutils-devel bzip2 which automake autoconf libtool zlib pkgconfig zlib-devel curl bison glibc* python-setuptools python-setuptools-devel python-devel swig numpy libcurl-devel scipy make
export WORK_DIR=`pwd`
#Install AdoptJDK cd $WORK_DIR wget https://github.com/AdoptOpenJDK/openjdk9-releases/releases/download/jdk-9%2B181/OpenJDK9_s390x_Linux_jdk-9.181.tar.gz tar -xvf OpenJDK9_s390x_Linux_jdk-9.181.tar.gz #Set Environment Variables export JAVA_HOME=$WORK_DIR/jdk-9+181/ export PATH=$JAVA_HOME/bin:$PATH java -version
#Build GCC 7.3.0 # wget ftp://gcc.gnu.org/pub/gcc/releases/gcc-6.1.0/gcc-6.1.0.tar.gz cd $WORK_DIR wget ftp://gcc.gnu.org/pub/gcc/releases/gcc-7.3.0/gcc-7.3.0.tar.gz tar -xvzf gcc-7.3.0.tar.gz cd gcc-7.3.0 ./contrib/download_prerequisites cd .. mkdir gccbuild cd gccbuild/ ../gcc-7.3.0/configure --prefix="/opt/gcc" --enable-shared --with-system-zlib --enable-threads=posix --enable-__cxa_atexit --enable-checking --enable-gnu-indirect-function --enable-languages="c,c++" --disable-bootstrap --disable-multilib make && sudo make install export PATH=/opt/gcc/bin:$PATH cd /opt/gcc/lib64 sudo cp /opt/gcc/lib64/libstdc++.so.6 /usr/lib64/libstdc++.so.6
# Install Node.js cd $WORK_DIR wget http://public.dhe.ibm.com/ibmdl/export/pub/systems/cloud/runtimes/nodejs/6.12.2.0/linux/s390x/ibm-6.12.2.0-node-v6.12.2-linux-s390x.bin chmod +x ibm-6.12.2.0-node-v6.12.2-linux-s390x.bin echo -e "LICENSE_ACCEPTED=TRUE\nUSER_INSTALL_DIR=$WORK_DIR/ibm/node\n-fileOverwrite_$WORK_DIR/ibm/node/_node_installation/uninstall.lax=Yes" > installer.properties cat installer.properties ./ibm-6.12.2.0-node-v6.12.2-linux-s390x.bin -f installer.properties -i silent
export PATH=$PATH:$WORK_DIR/ibm/node/bin node -v
#Get Kibana release package and extract cd $WORK_DIR wget https://artifacts.elastic.co/downloads/kibana/kibana-6.2.2-linux-x86_64.tar.gz tar xvf kibana-6.2.2-linux-x86_64.tar.gz
#Replace Node.js in the package with the installed IBM SDK for Node.js. cd kibana-6.2.2-linux-x86_64 mv node node_old ln -s $WORK_DIR/ibm/node node
# Start Kibana cd $WORK_DIR wget https://artifacts.elastic.co/downloads/elasticsearch/elasticsearch-6.2.2.tar.gz tar -xvf elasticsearch-6.2.2.tar.gz ls nohup elasticsearch-6.2.2/bin/elasticsearch & sleep 2m
cd $WORK_DIR/kibana-6.2.2-linux-x86_64 bin/kibana -H 0.0.0.0 &
sleep 2m
curl http://localhost:5601
pgrep -d" " -f "node" | xargs kill; pgrep -d" " -f "elasticsearch" | xargs kill;
